sentences.en: “It helps if one was raised to tough it out”(&b{Gail Sheehy})
sentences.cn: “如果一个人在艰难困苦中长大，这对他很有帮助”(&b{盖尔·希伊})

sentences.en: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.cn: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.en: According to Mandy, Pat's tough exterior hides a shy and sensitive soul.
sentences.cn: 据曼迪说，帕特彪悍的外表下隐藏着一颗害羞且敏感的心。

sentences.en: Amateurs fall by the wayside when the going gets tough.
sentences.cn: 业余爱好者遇到困难时往往半途而废。

sentences.en: Cabinet ministers signalled their determination to tough out the controversy.
sentences.cn: 内阁大臣们表明他们将不顾争议坚持下去。

sentences.en: Do you believe that sentences for criminals are tough enough at present?
sentences.cn: 你认为当前对罪犯的判决足够严厉吗？

sentences.en: Even among seasoned mountaineers Pinnacle Ridge is considered quite a tough proposition.
sentences.cn: 即使在经验丰富的登山者中，平纳克尔峰也被认为是很难攀登的。

sentences.en: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.cn: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

sentences.en: He built up a reputation as a tough businessman.
sentences.cn: 他树立了铁面生意人的名声。

sentences.en: He’s as tough as nails – a good man to have on the team.
sentences.cn: 他是个很坚韧的人——队里有他真好。

sentences.en: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.cn: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.en: I think it was very brave of him to tough it out.
sentences.cn: 我认为他坚持到底非常勇敢。

sentences.en: In industry, diamond can form a tough, non-corrosive coating for tools.
sentences.cn: 在工业上，金刚石可以用作工具表面坚固、耐腐蚀的覆盖层。

sentences.en: It was a tough race.
sentences.cn: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.en: It was a very tough decision but we feel we made the right one.
sentences.cn: 这是一个非常困难的决定，但我们觉得自己做出了正确的选择。

sentences.en: She is tough, unwilling to take no for an answer.
sentences.cn: 她很强硬，不达目的誓不罢休。

sentences.en: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.cn: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.en: The children have to sit a tough selection test.
sentences.cn: 孩子们必须参加一次严格的选拔测试。

sentences.en: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.cn: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.en: The Daily Express describes Dr Carey as a pretty tough nut.
sentences.cn: 《每日快报》把凯里医生说成是特别难对付的家伙。

sentences.en: The EU is taking a tough line with the UK over this issue.
sentences.cn: 在这一问题上，欧盟对英国的态度很强硬。

sentences.en: The men who work on the oil rigs are a tough bunch.
sentences.cn: 在石油钻塔上工作的都是吃苦耐劳的人。

sentences.en: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.cn: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.en: The steak was tough and the peas were like bullets.
sentences.cn: 牛排老得嚼不动，豌豆像子弹一样硬。

sentences.en: They're both tough taskmasters, but Stephen is much more supportive.
sentences.cn: 他们俩都是严厉的工头，不过斯蒂芬更喜欢帮助他人。

sentences.en: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.cn: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.en: Trim any tough or woody stalks from the asparagus.
sentences.cn: 剪掉芦笋上粗硬或老掉的梗子。

sentences.en: Washington played tough in the second half of the game.
sentences.cn: 华盛顿队在比赛的下半场表现得十分顽强。

sentences.en: We'll face a tough fight in the upcoming election.
sentences.cn: 在即将到来的选举中，我们将面临一场恶斗。

phrases.tran_cn: 非常坚强的人；不易动感情的人；自信者
尽管有困难而熬过；忍受
严厉的爱（指为起到帮助作用而严厉地对待有问题的人）
大胆果断的人；暴躁的人
(粗俚)活该（表示对某人的不同情）

trans.tran_cn: 棘手的，坚强的，粗野的，治安很差的，艰难的，强硬的，坚固的，嚼不动的，倒霉的
trans.tran_en: physically or emotionally strong and able to deal with difficult situations
in a way that shows you are very determined
someone who often behaves in a violent way
